text: The @SFGiants used the first pick of the 2020 MLB draft, No. 13 overall, on North Carolina State catcher Patrick Bailey a surprising selection in light of Joey Bart’s status as Buster Posey’s heir apparent, writes @HankSchulman. #MLBdraft https://t.co/z3FOZa69NW

text: JUST IN: San Francisco's DA has launched a criminal probe after a sheriff’s deputy was seen shoving a protester to the ground, in cell phone video taken during a Black Lives Matter protest. https://t.co/naF2m2kA2s

name: sfchronicle
text: California lawmakers advanced a constitutional amendment Wednesday to overturn Proposition 209, the affirmative action ban approved by state voters in the 1990s that critics say perpetuates inequality for women and people of color, reports @akoseff. https://t.co/bMLcEho3z4

name: sfchronicle
text: The @Athletics used the 26th pick in Wednesday’s draft to select catcher Tyler Soderstrom, the son of former @SFGiants pitcher Steve Soderstrom. He’s the first high school catcher the A's have taken in the first round since 1974, reports @SusanSlusser. https://t.co/ymOkIAWk4L

name: sfchronicle
text: California reported 107 deaths from the coronavirus today — it's the first time since May 21 that the state has recorded triple-digit deaths. https://t.co/Zr0LXLx247

name: sfchronicle
text: Coronavirus update: Health officials reported 203 new cases of coronavirus among California health care workers on Wednesday, bringing the total to 11,374 cases. Sixty-seven state health care workers have died. https://t.co/CMOnz0uXwo

name: sfchronicle
text: The state Judicial Council repealed its statewide zero-bail policy for nonviolent offenses, effective June 20, allowing local courts to require defendants accused of nonviolent crimes to post bail to be released from jail. https://t.co/ILoCuV5ghj

name: sfchronicle
text:
JUST IN: Oakland’s superintendent and a majority of the school board have backed a proposal to get rid of the school district’s police department.
https://t.co/IObLlqvq5N

name: sfchronicle
text:
The measure, the "George Floyd Resolution to Eliminate the Oakland Schools Police Department," would redirect $2.8 million now spent on armed officers to students. 

More than two dozen principals opposed the proposal. 

https://t.co/6IIiQos57s

name: sfchronicle
text:
Hundreds of mostly young Oakland residents were gathered as they prepared to march to the home of Mayor Libby Schaaf, calling on her to redirect police funding toward education and homelessness. 

https://t.co/UJTR0jzpux

name: sfchronicle
text:
The number of confirmed coronavirus cases in the U.S. stood just shy of 2 million at 1,999,900 on Wednesday evening, according to Johns Hopkins University.

Nearly 113,000 Americans have died from COVID-19 during the pandemic.

https://t.co/6Zpnlw9CQe

name: sfchronicle
text:
From the Oakland protests:

- 200+ businesses looted or vandalized
- 137 arson fires started
- “Numerous” shootings occurred
- 30+ first responders injured
- Four people in crowds injured 
- 300+ people were arrested with more investigations pending
